doc.title: Jefferies
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Quick Take Alibaba Jun Quarter ResultsQuick Take Alibaba Jun Quarter Results_2025-08-29

passages.text: China (PRC) | Internet Alibaba

Alibaba reported results with total revenue \(2.2\%\) and \(1.8\%\) below consensus and our estimates respectively on softer than expected All Others. For Alibaba China E- commerce Group, CMR grew \(10\%\) YoY to RMB89.3bn (in line with our estimate). For Alibaba Cloud, revenue grew \(26\%\) YoY (vs consensus at \(21\%\) ) and adjusted EBITA margin reached \(8.8\%\) (vs consensus at \(8.6\%\) ). Overall adjusted EBITA declined by \(14\%\) YoY to RMB38.8bn (in line with our estimate).
Jun quarter results highlights. Total revenue grew \(2\%\) YoY to RMB248bn, \(2.2\%\) and \(1.8\%\) below consensus and our estimate respectively.

- Alibaba China E-commerce Group grew by \(10\%\) YoY to RMB140bn (vs our estimate at about RMB139bn). For China ecommerce business, revenue increased by \(9\%\) YoY to RMB118.6bn, among which CMR grew \(10\%\) YoY (vs consensus and our estimates at \(10.5\%\) YoY).- For Alibaba International Digital Commerce Group (AIDC), revenue grew at \(19\%\) YoY (vs consensus and our estimates at \(20\%\) YoY) to RMB34.7bn.- For Cloud Intelligence Group, revenue grew \(26\%\) YoY (vs consensus and our estimates at \(21\%\) and \(23\%\) YoY, respectively) to RMB33.4bn.- All Others revenue declined by \(28\%\) YoY to RMB58.6bn (vs our estimate at RMB63bn).- Overall adjusted EBITA declined by \(14\%\) YoY to RMB38.8bn (in line with our estimate). Adjusted EBITA margin declined by \(3\mathrm{pp}\) YoY to \(16\%\) (vs our estimate at \(15\%\) ). For Alibaba China E-commerce Group, segment adjusted EBITA declined \(21\%\) YoY (vs our estimate of \(20\%\) YoY decline) to RMB38.4bn. For Alibaba Cloud, segment adjusted EBITA margin reached \(8.8\%\) (vs consensus at \(8.6\%\) and our estimate of \(8.4\%\) ).- Overall adjusted EBITDA declined by \(11\%\) YoY to RMB45.7bn (vs our estimate at RMB45.3bn).- Non-GAAP net income attributable to shareholders reached RMB35.3bn, vs consensus and our estimate at RMB37.6bn and RMB33.9bn, respectively.- Capital expenditure reached RMB38.7bn during the quarter

Focus areas during the upcoming conference call. These include: (1) food delivery and instant commerce strategies after Taobao Instant Commerce announced the investment of RMB50bn to consumers and merchants on 2 Jul; (2) synergies between food delivery/instant commerce with traditional ecommerce; (3) trends in DAU, DAC and time spent; (4) Alibaba Cloud revenue growth momentum in the coming quarters and AI growth momentum; (5) Alibaba Cloud margin trend; (6) updates on the latest trends in consumer sentiment and competitive landscape; (7) GMV growth momentum in recent months and expectations for the coming quarters; (8) CMR trends and gap with GMV on YoY basis in the coming quarters; (9) capex trend in the coming quarters; (10) international strategy updates and competitive landscape of online shopping in Southeast Asia; (11) EBITA trends for TTG and the overall business; (12) updates on shareholder returns, including share repurchases, dividends, and value of non- core assets.
Dial in call details: Alibaba will host a conference call at 7:30 am ET (7:30 pm HKT) on 29 Aug 2025.
Participant Registration link below:

TICKER9988 HKPRICEHK$115.80^PRICE TARGET | % TO PTHK$145.00 | +25%
Chinese: https://s1.c- conf.com/diamondpass/10048829- vs9tz3. html

We would like to thank Fiona Fan, employee of Evaluesence Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report. We would like to thank Han Wang, employee of Evaluesence Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this repor. We would like to thank Erica Qiu, employee of Evaluesence Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report.

Alibaba is the largest online and mobile commerce company in the world in terms of gross merchandise volume in 2013, according to industry sources. The company operates its marketplaces as platforms for third parties and does not engage in direct sales, compete with merchants, or hold inventory.

Our price target of US \(150 / HK\) 145 is based on SOTP valuation. Key risks include (1) severe macroeconomic slowdown impacts online shopping growth; (2) aggressive marketing spending in local services and globalization due to intensified competition; and (3) user growth falls below expectations.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company. NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations. Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
